conclusion: To determine the magnitude of the frictional force exerted by the ground on the long wooden board ab, we need to analyze the forces acting on both the block P and the board ab.
The block P has a mass m and slides on the board ab with a velocity v.

The forces acting on P are gravitational force mg (downward), normal force from the board ab: N_P (upward), and kinetic frictional force from the board ab: f_{P,ab} = μ2 N_P (opposite to the direction of motion).

premise: The block is on a horizontal surface.
conclusion: The normal force N_P is equal to the gravitational force: N_P = mg.
The frictional force exerted by the board ab on the block P is f_{P,ab} = μ2 mg.
The board ab has a mass M and is stationary.

The forces acting on ab are gravitational force Mg (downward), normal force from the ground: N_{ab} (upward), frictional force from the block P: f_{ab,P} = μ2 mg, and frictional force from the ground: f_{ground}.

premise: The total normal force from the ground on the board ab is the sum of the weights of the block and the board.
The frictional force exerted by the ground on the board ab must balance the frictional force exerted by the block P on the board ab to keep the board stationary.
